name: Remy Russell
productManagement: Ensure success of the business and customers
Understand the customer and user experience to prioritize the best opportunities
Use quantitative and qualitative analysis to discover problems worth solving
Inspire cross-functional collaboration to design and develop valuable product features
Prioritize tasks for engineers and partner with internal stakeholders to align on strategy

professionalExperience.description: Product Lead on the Interoperability team for a Case Management platform used by social service providers (Homeless Management, Medically tailored meals, refugee resettlement)
highlights: Partnered with customers and engineers to iterate and release new product features, including a RESTful API, an app for service recipients, and various integrations
Elicited feedback to prioritize valuable initiatives, evolving the platform’s integration capabilities
Analyzed APIs and integration specs to define technical requirements for engineering teams
Managed stakeholder communication and owned relationships with external users and partners
Facilitated agile ceremonies (sprint planning, backlog refinement, retrospectives) to drive delivery
Maintained the roadmap, set KPIs, and leveraged feedback/data for continuous improvement
achievements: Increased platform adoption by 30% through successful API and app releases
Reduced integration setup time by 25% with optimized technical requirements

professionalExperience.position: Business Analyst II, MMIS Implementation Project
professionalExperience.description: Worked with internal team and stakeholders from the Utah Department of Health on system migration and gap analysis activities for implementation of a Medicaid Management Information System (MMIS)
highlights: Documented comprehensive design details for the Provider Enrollment Subsystem to guide development and testing
achievements: Improved project efficiency by streamlining gap analysis processes

professionalExperience.description: Learned the end-to-end functionality of CNSI’s 'Electronic Medicaid Incentive Payment Program' solution and re-authored technical documentation to comply with standards in the field
highlights: Analyzed program mandates published by the Center for Medicaid Services to design and implement compliant functionality
achievements: Enhanced documentation accuracy, reducing compliance issues by 15%

professionalExperience.position: Intern, Web Design for College of Engineering OSA
professionalExperience.description: Collaborated with over ten departments/programs on behalf of the College of Engineering Office of Student Affairs (OSA) to create, reorganize, and redesign web content under a new content management system
highlights: Improved user interface and continuity across web pages
achievements: Increased user satisfaction by 20% through redesigned web content

education.degree: BSE in Industrial & Operations Engineering, Certificate in Entrepreneurship 2015
education.coursework: Relational database design, computer programming, process improvement, modeling, simulation, statistical analysis, decision analysis, lean management, business development, entrepreneurship

coreSkills: Technical communication and cross-functional collaboration with engineers
Problem-solving and ownership of complex challenges
Ability to articulate technical details and high-level strategy
Quick learner of new tools, technologies, and methodologies
HL7 fundamentals (v2.x and FHIR) with v2.x ADT and CDA integration experience
toolsAndFrameworks: Microsoft (Azure, Power Automate, Office Suite), Atlassian (Jira, Confluence), ProductBoard, Postman, Lucidchart
fun: Outdoor activities (skiing, mountain biking, hiking, camping)
Podcasts/audiobooks on tech, healthcare, business, investing
